lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Nikolay Davydenko left Jiri Vanek reeling with a 6-0, 6-0 defeat yesterday in the first round of the Kremlin Cup in Moscow. Davydenko, a semifinalist at the United States Open last month, was joined in the second round by his fellow Russian Marat Safin, who defeated Nicolas Mahut, 6-3, 6-4.
